spec.description: Configuration affecting load balancing, outlier detection, etc. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/destination-rule.html

exportTo.description: A list of namespaces to which this destination rule is exported.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

subsets.description: One or more named sets that represent individual versions of a service.

labels.description: Labels apply a filter over the endpoints of a service in the service registry.

trafficPolicy.description: Traffic policies that apply to this subset.

h2UpgradePolicy.description: Specify if http1.1 connection should be upgraded to http2 for the associated destination.

http1MaxPendingRequests.description: Maximum number of requests that will be queued while waiting for a ready connection pool connection.

http2MaxRequests.description: Maximum number of active requests to a destination.

idleTimeout.description: The idle timeout for upstream connection pool connections.

maxConcurrentStreams.description: The maximum number of concurrent streams allowed for a peer on one HTTP/2 connection.

maxRequestsPerConnection.description: Maximum number of requests per connection to a backend.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries that can be outstanding to all hosts in a cluster at a given time.

useClientProtocol.description: If set to true, client protocol will be preserved while initiating connection to backend.

tcp.description: Settings common to both HTTP and TCP upstream connections.

idleTimeout.description: The idle timeout for TCP connections.

maxConnectionDuration.description: The maximum duration of a connection.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of HTTP1 /TCP connections to a destination host.

tcpKeepalive.description: If set then set SO_KEEPALIVE on the socket to enable TCP Keepalives.

interval.description: The time duration between keep-alive probes.

probes.description: Maximum number of keepalive probes to send without response before deciding the connection is dead.

time.description: The time duration a connection needs to be idle before keep-alive probes start being sent.

loadBalancer.description: Settings controlling the load balancer algorithms.

path.description: Path to set for the cookie.

httpHeaderName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP header.

httpQueryParameterName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP query parameter.

maglev.description: The Maglev load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

tableSize.description: The table size for Maglev hashing.

ringHash.description: The ring/modulo hash load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

minimumRingSize.description: The minimum number of virtual nodes to use for the hash ring.

useSourceIp.description: Hash based on the source IP address.

distribute.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Map of upstream localities to traffic distribution weights.

enabled.description: enable locality load balancing, this is DestinationRule-level and will override mesh wide settings in entirety.

failover.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Destination region the traffic will fail over to when endpoints in the 'from' region becomes unhealthy.

failoverPriority.description: failoverPriority is an ordered list of labels used to sort endpoints to do priority based load balancing.

warmupDurationSecs.description: Represents the warmup duration of Service.

consecutive5xxErrors.description: Number of 5xx errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

consecutiveGatewayErrors.description: Number of gateway errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

consecutiveLocalOriginFailures.description: The number of consecutive locally originated failures before ejection occurs.

interval.description: Time interval between ejection sweep analysis.

maxEjectionPercent.description: Maximum % of hosts in the load balancing pool for the upstream service that can be ejected.

minHealthPercent.description: Outlier detection will be enabled as long as the associated load balancing pool has at least min_health_percent hosts in healthy mode.

splitExternalLocalOriginErrors.description: Determines whether to distinguish local origin failures from external errors.

portLevelSettings.description: Traffic policies specific to individual ports.

h2UpgradePolicy.description: Specify if http1.1 connection should be upgraded to http2 for the associated destination.

http1MaxPendingRequests.description: Maximum number of requests that will be queued while waiting for a ready connection pool connection.

http2MaxRequests.description: Maximum number of active requests to a destination.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries that can be outstanding to all hosts in a cluster at a given time.

time.description: The time duration a connection needs to be idle before keep-alive probes start being sent.

httpQueryParameterName.description: Hash based on a specific HTTP query parameter.

tableSize.description: The table size for Maglev hashing.

ringHash.description: The ring/modulo hash load balancer implements consistent hashing to backend hosts.

minimumRingSize.description: The minimum number of virtual nodes to use for the hash ring.

useSourceIp.description: Hash based on the source IP address.

distribute.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Map of upstream localities to traffic distribution weights.

enabled.description: enable locality load balancing, this is DestinationRule-level and will override mesh wide settings in entirety.

failover.description: Optional: only one of distribute, failover or failoverPriority can be set.

to.description: Destination region the traffic will fail over to when endpoints in the 'from' region becomes unhealthy.

failoverPriority.description: failoverPriority is an ordered list of labels used to sort endpoints to do priority based load balancing.

warmupDurationSecs.description: Represents the warmup duration of Service.

consecutive5xxErrors.description: Number of 5xx errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

consecutiveGatewayErrors.description: Number of gateway errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.

consecutiveLocalOriginFailures.description: The number of consecutive locally originated failures before ejection occurs.

interval.description: Time interval between ejection sweep analysis.

maxEjectionPercent.description: Maximum % of hosts in the load balancing pool for the upstream service that can be ejected.

minHealthPercent.description: Outlier detection will be enabled as long as the associated load balancing pool has at least min_health_percent hosts in healthy mode.

splitExternalLocalOriginErrors.description: Determines whether to distinguish local origin failures from external errors.

port.description: Specifies the number of a port on the destination service on which this policy is being applied.

tls.description: TLS related settings for connections to the upstream service.

caCertificates.description: OPTIONAL: The path to the file containing certificate authority certificates to use in verifying a presented server certificate.

credentialName.description: The name of the secret that holds the TLS certs for the client including the CA certificates.

insecureSkipVerify.description: `insecureSkipVerify` specifies whether the proxy should skip verifying the CA signature and SAN for the server certificate corresponding to the host.

mode.description: Indicates whether connections to this port should be secured using TLS.

sni.description: SNI string to present to the server during TLS handshake.

subjectAltNames.description: A list of alternate names to verify the subject identity in the certificate.

version.description: The PROXY protocol version to use.

tls.description: TLS related settings for connections to the upstream service.

caCertificates.description: OPTIONAL: The path to the file containing certificate authority certificates to use in verifying a presented server certificate.

credentialName.description: The name of the secret that holds the TLS certs for the client including the CA certificates.

insecureSkipVerify.description: `insecureSkipVerify` specifies whether the proxy should skip verifying the CA signature and SAN for the server certificate corresponding to the host.

mode.description: Indicates whether connections to this port should be secured using TLS.

sni.description: SNI string to present to the server during TLS handshake.

subjectAltNames.description: A list of alternate names to verify the subject identity in the certificate.

tunnel.description: Configuration of tunneling TCP over other transport or application layers for the host configured in the DestinationRule.

protocol.description: Specifies which protocol to use for tunneling the downstream connection.

targetHost.description: Specifies a host to which the downstream connection is tunneled.

targetPort.description: Specifies a port to which the downstream connection is tunneled.

trafficPolicy.description: Traffic policies to apply (load balancing policy, connection pool sizes, outlier detection).

h2UpgradePolicy.description: Specify if http1.1 connection should be upgraded to http2 for the associated destination.

workloadSelector.description: Criteria used to select the specific set of pods/VMs on which this `DestinationRule` configuration should be applied.

matchLabels.description: One or more labels that indicate a specific set of pods/VMs on which a policy should be applied.
